meanings.definition: The quality of being easily bent or shaped.
meanings.sent1: The pliablenesses of the clay allowed the artist to create intricate sculptures.
meanings.sent2: The plasticity of the dough demonstrated its pliablenesses when molded into different shapes.
meanings.sent3: The pliablenesses of the rubber band made it a fun toy for the children to stretch and play with.
meanings.sent4: Her mind showed the pliablenesses of a flexible tree branch, adapting to new ideas effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The pliablenesses of the fabric made it easy to drape and sew into elegant dresses.

meanings.definition: The state of being easily influenced or persuaded.
meanings.sent1: His pliablenesses in decision-making often led him to follow others' suggestions without much resistance.
meanings.sent2: The pliablenesses of her character made her vulnerable to the influence of peer pressure.
meanings.sent3: The pliablenesses of his opinions were like a leaf in the wind, changing direction with every new argument.
meanings.sent4: Her pliablenesses in negotiations made her a skilled mediator, adapting to different viewpoints with ease.
meanings.sent5: The pliablenesses of his beliefs made him open-minded and receptive to new perspectives.
